Package gui.media

Class GUIPolygon

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.layout.Pane
gui.media.GUIMedia<GenericShape>
gui.media.GUIShape
gui.media.GUIPolygon
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class GUIPolygon extends GUIShape
An implementation of the GUIShape class representing a polygon

  • Constructor Details

    • GUIPolygon

      public GUIPolygon(javafx.geometry.Point2D p1, javafx.geometry.Point2D p2, javafx.scene.paint.Color colour, int sideCount)
      Initializes and draws GUIPolygon with the following settings
      Parameters:
      p1 - The position of the polygon's center
      p2 - The position which determine's the polygon's radius and starting angle
      colour - The polygon's color
      sideCount - The number of sides of the polygon

    • GUIPolygon

      public GUIPolygon(PolygonShape media)
      Constructs a GUIEllipse from a EllipseShape
      Parameters:
      media - The EllipseShape to base a new GUIEllipse off of

  • Method Details

    • setGenericShape

      public void setGenericShape(GenericShape polygon)
      Creates a GUIShape from its corresponding GenericShape

      Must contain a generic PolygonShape for proper operation

      Specified by:
      setGenericShape in class GUIShape
      Parameters:
      polygon - A GenericShape to be represented as a new GUIShape

    • update

      public void update(javafx.geometry.Point2D p1, javafx.geometry.Point2D p2, boolean sameSideLengths)
      Called when changing the position or dimensions of a shape
      Specified by:
      update in class GUIShape
      Parameters:
      p1 - The position of the polygon's center
      p2 - The position which determines the polygon's radius and starting angle
      sameSideLengths - Has no effect for a polygon

    • calcPointsFromRadiusAngle

      public Double[] calcPointsFromRadiusAngle(double radius, double angle, int sideCount)
      Generates a list of points representing the vertices of a polygon with an arbitrary orientation and dimensions.

      This always creates a Regular Shape, which is a shape with equal side lengths.

      Parameters:
      radius - The distance from the
      angle - The rotational offset of the polygon
      sideCount - The number of sides of the polygon
      Returns:
      A list of points representing the polygon's vertices

    • calcPointsFromPoints

      public Double[] calcPointsFromPoints(javafx.geometry.Point2D p1, javafx.geometry.Point2D p2, int sideCount)
      Generates a list of points representing the vertices of a polygon with an arbitrary orientation and dimensions.

      This always creates a Regular Shape, which is a shape with equal side lengths.

      Parameters:
      p1 - The location of the center of the polygon
      p2 - The location of the top most vertex of the polygon (used for determining direction)
      sideCount - The number of sides of the polygon
      Returns:
      A list of points representing the polygon's vertices

    • calcAngle

      public static double calcAngle(javafx.geometry.Point2D p1, javafx.geometry.Point2D p2)
      Returns the angle of the vector connecting two points
      Parameters:
      p1 - The tail of the vector
      p2 - The head of the vector
      Returns:
      The angle of the vector connecting two points
